sections.title: What date did your business first commercially exploit aggregates?

fields.label: What date did your business first commercially exploit aggregates?
fields.helpText: Enter the date your business first commercially exploited aggregates or formed the intention to. For example 21 4 2018

fields.label: What is commercially exploiting aggregates?
fields.infoText:
Aggregate is considered as being commercially exploited when it is exploited for the benefit of business. For example when it is:

* subject to an agreement to supply (such as a contract)

* used for construction purposes 

* mixed with anything other than water, except in permitted circumstances 

*removed from its originating site or a connected site that is registered under the same name 

You become liable to register for aggregates  levy when you first commercially exploit aggregates or form the intention to.

Full details are given in Excise Notice AGL1.

sections.title: Do you expect any of your commercial activity to be exempt or relieved from the levy?

fields.label: What commercial activity is exempt or relieved from the levy?
fields.infoText:
Commercial aggregates activitity involving the following substances (when they make up more than half of the total material) are exempt from the levy:

* coal, lignite, clay, slate, soil or vegetable or other organic matter

* blocks of stone (dimension stone) and limestone for the production of lime or cement

* certain industrial minerals (such as metal ores, gypsum, fluorspar)

* waste that's wholly from industrial combustion processes or the smelting or refining of metals

* drill cuttings (in permitted circumstances) and waste from certain processes such as highways or railways excavation, navigational dredging and building construction (in permitted circumstances)

Commercial activity involving the following aggregates are relieved from the levy:

* any aggregate used in certain industrial or agricultural processes (such as glass manufacture, fertiliser production)

* aggregate that has previously carried levy and to which an exempt process is applied

Relief can also be obtained on aggregates that are exported to a destination outside of the UK.

Full details of the exemptions and reliefs are given in Excise Notices AGL1 and AGL2.
